title: 5 best new restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston (Feb. 12, 2026)
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Citrus & Salt to open its second coastal Mexican location with patio dining in Burlington, Summer 2026.
Moro Mou's 15-seat omakase spot blending Greek and Japanese cuisine opens in Seaport, Summer 2026.
The Down Low offers cocktail experience and live entertainment in Woburn, now open at 371 Main St.

title: Nikola Vucevic, Celtics roll into All-Star break with blowout win over Bulls: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Nikola Vucevic scored 19 points off the bench, leading the Celtics to a 124-105 victory over the Bulls.
The Celtics dominated the second quarter, outscoring the Bulls 36-17 to take control of the game.
Anfernee Simons expressed openness to returning to Boston after being traded for financial reasons.

title: ‘Modern day concentration camp’: Irish man living in Boston area has been in ICE detention for 5 months
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Irish man Seamus Culleton, living in the Boston area, has been detained by ICE for five months.
Culleton, who overstayed his visa in 2009, is married to a U.S. citizen and has a pending green card application.
ICE detention conditions criticized; DHS claims Culleton had due process and was offered removal to Ireland.

title: Will Patriots move on from Stefon Diggs? Maye says WR has a lot ‘left in the tank’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stefon Diggs, despite a strong season with over 1,000 receiving yards, faces potential release due to his high base salary.
Releasing Diggs before June 1 could save the Patriots $16.8 million, rising to $20.8 million if released post-June 1.
Diggs, turning 33 in November, faces legal issues, including assault allegation denying accusations with court support from the Patriots.

title: Watch: Maynard police, fire crews save dog from ‘pet owner’s worst nightmare’
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Maynard police and fire crews rescued a dog that fell through ice at Mill Pond, Maynard, on Tuesday night.
Responders used a drone to guide the firefighters in locating and rescuing the dog, Rufus, from icy waters.
Rufus was saved within ten minutes with no serious injuries, ensuring a full recovery, according to officials.

title: Signal issues cause multiple delays and cancellations on at least 6 commuter rail lines
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Signal issues caused significant delays on all 12 MBTA commuter rail lines Wednesday, impacting service throughout the day.
Over 25 commuter rail trains faced cancellations, with delays extending up to 50 minutes starting from the morning.
A separate power issue on the Blue Line required shuttle buses between Orient Heights and Wonderland due to a track problem.

title: Former Worcester councilor found guilty of assault on police officer related to ICE arrest
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Etel Haxhiaj, former Worcester councilor, was found guilty of assaulting a police officer during an ICE arrest incident.
Haxhiaj was sentenced to six months probation and 40 hours of community service but acquitted of interfering with an officer.
The incident happened during an ICE arrest in 2025; Haxhiaj was accused of shoving an officer while intervening.

title: JetBlue lounge at Logan Airport will make its debut this summer
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: JetBlue's BlueHouse BOS lounge will debut at Logan Airport's Terminal C, near gate C23, this summer.
The Boston lounge, at 11,000 square feet, is nearly 40% larger than the 8,000 square-foot JFK lounge.
Amenities include complimentary food, a full-service bar, private workspaces, and uniquely Boston art and design.

title: ESPN predicts Patriots will target offensive lineman with 1st-round pick in 2026 NFL Draft
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: ESPN's Field Yates predicts the Patriots will select Utah offensive tackle Caleb Lomu with their 2026 first-round pick.
The Patriots' offensive line struggled in Super Bowl LX, prompting speculation about bolstering protection for quarterback Drake Maye.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel supports keeping Will Campbell at left tackle despite postseason performance criticism.

title: New Red Sox Caleb Durbin models his game after former Boston MVP
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Caleb Durbin, 5-foot-7 infielder, joins the Red Sox after a trade with the Brewers, focusing on strong defense.
Durbin draws inspiration from former Red Sox star Dustin Pedroia, aiming for a similar playing style and impact.
In 2025, Durbin hit 11 home runs with a .387 slugging percentage, seeking to improve power at Fenway Park.
